text: Did you know the water you drank today might have been part of a dinosaur’s bath millions of years ago? Water on Earth is constantly recycled in a magical journey called the water cycle! It evaporates from oceans, forms clouds, rains down, and flows back to rivers. Think of it like nature’s recycling program—every drop counts!

text: Ever seen a soda can ‘sweat’ on a hot day? That’s condensation—just like how water droplets form on leaves in the morning! Plants also join the water cycle by ‘breathing out’ water vapor. Next time you see a cloud, imagine it’s a giant floating storyteller, carrying water’s adventures across the sky. How cool is that?
